00002 /**
00003  *  Implementation of the Peer-to-Peer protocol over datagram channel 
00004  */
00005 package protocol;
00006 
00007 import java.io.IOException;
00008 import java.net.DatagramPacket;
00009 import java.net.DatagramSocket;
00010 import java.net.InetAddress;
00011 import java.net.SocketException;
00012 import java.net.UnknownHostException;
00013 
00014 import crypto.SymmetricCipher;
00015 
00016 import utils.Log;
00017 import utils.OctetBuffer;

00019 /**
00020  *  Binds the UDP port. Each peer is associated with one DatagramChannel object.
00021  *  
00022  *  @author Mikica B Kocic
00023  */
00024 public class DatagramChannel implements Runnable
00025 {
00026     /** The default size for the inbound UDP buffer */
00027     private final static int INBOUND_UDP_BUFFER_SIZE = 4096;
00028 
00029     /** The local UDP port where datagram socket is bound */
00030     private int localPort;
00031 
00032     /** The UDP receiver socket */
00033     private DatagramSocket udpReceiver;
00034     
00035     /** The UDP receiver worker thread */
00036     private Thread pduReceiverThread;
00037     
00038     /** Indicates that worker thread should be running (receiving datagrams) */
00039     private volatile boolean running;
00040     
00041     /** Current remote peer receiving datagrams from UDP socket*/
00042     private RemotePeer remotePeer;
00043     
00044     /** Currently used symmetric cipher */
00045     private SymmetricCipher usedPduCipher;
00046 
00047     /**
00048      *  Constructor for the DatagramChannel object
00049      *
00050      *  @param localPort  local UDP port receiving peer's PDUs
00051      * 
00052      *  @throws SocketException Thrown if the UDP socket cannot be created
00053      *  @throws UnknownHostException Thrown if the remoteHost cannot be resolved
00054      */
00055     public DatagramChannel( int localPort )
00056     {
00057         this.remotePeer = null;
00058         this.usedPduCipher = null;
00059 
00060         this.running = false;
00061         this.localPort = -1;
00062         
00063         for( int i = localPort; i < localPort + 100; ++i )
00064         {
00065             try {
00066                 this.udpReceiver = new DatagramSocket( i );
00067                 this.localPort = i;
00068                 break;
00069             } catch( SocketException e ) {
00070                 /* ignore error and continue search for unbound port */
00071             }
00072         }
00073         
00074         /* If binded UDP port, start worker thread.
00075          */
00076         if ( this.localPort > 0 ) 
00077         {
00078             Log.trace( "Bound to UDP port " + this.localPort );
00079             this.running = true;
00080             pduReceiverThread = new Thread( this, "UDP" );
00081             pduReceiverThread.setPriority( Thread.MAX_PRIORITY - 1 );
00082             pduReceiverThread.start ();
00083         }
00084     }
00085 
00086     /**
00087      *  Returns used local UDP port.
00088      */
00089     public int getLocalPort ()
00090     {
00091         return this.udpReceiver.getLocalPort ();
00092     }
00093 
00094     /**
00095      *  Sets cipher to be used for PDU ciphering 
00096      */
00097     public void useSymmetricCipher( SymmetricCipher cipherEngine )
00098     {
00099         usedPduCipher = cipherEngine;
00100         
00101         if ( cipherEngine != null ) {
00102             Log.trace( "Using PDU cipher: " + cipherEngine.getAlgorithmDesc () );
00103         }
00104     }
00105 
00106     /**
00107      *  Gets current cipher used for PDU ciphering 
00108      */
00109     public SymmetricCipher getUsedSymmetricCipher ()
00110     {
00111         return this.usedPduCipher;
00112     }
00113 
00114     /**
00115      *  Adds new peer to receive incoming PDUs
00116      */
00117     public void addNewPeer( RemotePeer remotePeer )
00118     {
00119         this.remotePeer = remotePeer;
00120     }
00121 
00122     /**
00123      *  Returns if there is active remote peer
00124      */
00125     public boolean hasRemotePeer ()
00126     {
00127         return this.remotePeer != null;
00128     }
00129 
00130     /**
00131      *  Returns the remote peer
00132      */
00133     public RemotePeer getRemotePeer ()
00134     {
00135         return this.remotePeer;
00136     }
00137 
00138     /**
00139      *  Returns if peer seems to be dead (we are not receiving PDUs from it).
00140      */
00141     public boolean isPearDead( int maxIdleTimeMillis )
00142     {
00143         if ( this.remotePeer == null ) {
00144             return false; // cannot be dead if does not exists
00145         }
00146         
00147         return this.remotePeer.receiverIdleTime () > maxIdleTimeMillis;
00148     }
00149     
00150     /**
00151      *  Detaches peer and all its call from the UDP receiver
00152      */
00153     public void removePeer ()
00154     {
00155         this.usedPduCipher = null;
00156 
00157         if ( this.remotePeer != null ) 
00158         {
00159             this.remotePeer.cleanUp ();
00160             this.remotePeer = null;
00161         }
00162     }
00163 
00164     /**
00165      *  Stops PDU receiver thread
00166      */
00167     public void stop ()
00168     {
00169         running = false;
00170         
00171         if ( pduReceiverThread != null )
00172         {
00173             udpReceiver.close ();
00174             Log.debug( "Closed Socket" );
00175             
00176             try
00177             {
00178                 pduReceiverThread.join ();
00179                 Log.debug( "Joined binder thread" );
00180             }
00181             catch( InterruptedException e )
00182             {
00183                 Log.exception( Log.WARN, e );
00184             }
00185             
00186             pduReceiverThread = null;
00187         }
00188     }
00189 
00190 
00191     /**
00192      *  Receives (and deciphers) PDUs from remote peers in a loop. 
00193      *  Dispatches inbound PDUs to associated instance of the RemotePeer
00194      *  that will handle PDUs.
00195      */
00196     public void run ()
00197     {
00198         Log.trace( "Thread started" );
00199 
00200         /* Receive and dispatch datagrams
00201          */
00202         byte[] buff = new byte[ INBOUND_UDP_BUFFER_SIZE ];
00203         
00204         while( running )
00205         {
00206             DatagramPacket packet = new DatagramPacket( buff, buff.length );
00207             
00208             try 
00209             {
00210                 udpReceiver.receive( packet );
00211                 
00212                 byte[] pdu = new byte[ packet.getLength () ];
00213                 System.arraycopy( buff, 0, pdu, 0, pdu.length );
00214 
00215                 InetAddress peerAddr = packet.getAddress ();
00216                 int peerPort = packet.getPort ();
00217 
00218                 // packetDump( pdu, pdu.length, peerAddr, peerPort, true );
00219                 
00220                 if ( usedPduCipher != null ) {
00221                     pdu = usedPduCipher.decrypt( /*randomPreambleLen*/ 8, pdu );
00222                 }
00223 
00224                 if ( pdu != null ) 
00225                 {
00226                     packetDump( pdu, pdu.length, peerAddr, peerPort, true );
00227     
00228                     if ( remotePeer != null ) {
00229                         remotePeer.addIncomingPDU( pdu );
00230                     }
00231                 }
00232             }
00233             catch( IOException e )
00234             {
00235                 if ( running ) {
00236                     Log.exception( Log.WARN, e );
00237                 }
00238             }
00239         }
00240     }
00241 
00242     /**
00243      *  Encrypts and sends PDUs to remote peer
00244      */
00245     public void send( OctetBuffer pdu, InetAddress peerAddr, int peerPort )
00246     {
00247         try
00248         {
00249             packetDump( pdu.getStore (), pdu.getPosition (), peerAddr, peerPort, false );
00250 
00251             byte[] datagram = new byte[ pdu.getPosition () ];
00252             System.arraycopy( pdu.getStore (), 0, datagram, 0, datagram.length );
00253             
00254             if ( usedPduCipher != null ) {
00255                 datagram = usedPduCipher.encrypt( /*randomPreambleLen*/ 8, datagram );
00256             }
00257 
00258             if ( datagram != null ) 
00259             {
00260                 // packetDump( datagram, datagram.length, peerAddr, peerPort, false );
00261                 
00262                 DatagramPacket packet = new DatagramPacket(
00263                         datagram, datagram.length, peerAddr, peerPort );
00264     
00265                 this.udpReceiver.send( packet );
00266             }
00267         }
00268         catch( Exception e )
00269         {
00270             Log.exception( Log.WARN, e );
00271         }
00272     }
00273     
00274     /**
00275      * Dumps information of a frame (in bytes) to standard error.
00276      *
00277      * @param octets   The octets of the in- or outgoing PDU
00278      * @param len      The size of PDU
00279      * @param addr     The remote host address
00280      * @param port     The port number
00281      * @param incoming Indicates if it is inbound (true) or outgoing (false) PDU
00282      */
00283     protected void packetDump(
00284             byte[] octets, int len, 
00285             InetAddress addr, int port, 
00286             boolean incoming )
00287     {
00288         if ( ! Log.isEnabled( Log.PDU ) ) {
00289             return;
00290         }
00291         
00292         StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer( 500 );
00293         
00294         sb.append( incoming ? "Packet from <--- " : "Packet to ---> " );
00295         
00296         sb.append( addr.getHostAddress() ).append( ":" ).append( port );
00297         
00298         sb.append( ", size = ").append( len ).append( "\n\n" );
00299         
00300         sb.append( Log.toHex( octets, len, " " ) ).append( "\n" );
00301         
00302         Log.pdu( sb.toString () );
00303     }
00304 }
